article_html:
The Kingstone Press League 1 game between London Skolars and Keighley Cougars was abandoned on Sunday after a Keighley player was rushed to hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

Danny Jones, a Welsh international who has previously played for clubs such as Halifax in the past, was taken from the field in the fourth minute of the game after sustaining an injury.

London Ambulance were called to the New River Stadium, home of the Skolars, at 3.10pm on Sunday afternoon, with an air ambulance and two crews sent for a patient in cardiac arrest.

A statement from London Ambulance said: “We were called at 3.10pm today to an address on White Hart Lane.

“We sent a number of resources including London’s Air Ambulance and two ambulance crews to the scene.

“The patient - a man - was in cardiac arrest.

“Extensive efforts were made to resuscitate him and he was taken by road ambulance to the Royal Free Hospital, with the air ambulance on board.”

The game was subsequently abandoned after 16 minutes with the score 12-6 to Keighley, with the RFL only confirming on Sunday evening that Jones had been taken to hospital and was receiving treatment for his injuries.

title: Danny Jones suffers cardiac arrest during Keighley rugby league game
